total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the locations of the numbers 1, 3, 4, 6, and 7 in the input grid.
Q2: Determine the number of rows and columns in the input grid.
Q3: Identify the locations of the number 5 in the input grid.
Q4: Determine the pattern of the number 5 in the input grid.
Q5: Based on the pattern of the number 5, determine the locations where the numbers 1, 3, 4, 6, and 7 should be placed in the output grid.
Q6: Replace the number 5 in the identified locations with the corresponding numbers 1, 3, 4, 6, and 7 in the output grid.
Q7: For the remaining cells filled with the number 5, determine the pattern of how they should be replaced based on the examples.
Q8: Replace the remaining cells filled with the number 5 according to the pattern determined in Q7.
Q1: Identify the locations of the numbers 1, 3, 4, 6, and 7 in the input grid.
Q2: Determine the color of the cells surrounding the numbers identified in Q1.
Q3: Identify the color that occupies the majority of the grid.
Q4: Replace the cells surrounding the numbers identified in Q1 with the color identified in Q3.
Q5: Replace the cells in the same row and column as the numbers identified in Q1 with the color identified in Q2.
Q1: Identify the locations of the numbers 1, 3, 4, 6, and 7 in the input grid.
Q2: Determine the color of the largest rectangle in the input grid.
Q3: Identify the locations of the rectangles that are not the largest rectangle.
Q4: Determine the color of the rectangles identified in Q3.
Q5: Change the color of the largest rectangle to the color of the rectangles identified in Q3.
Q6: Change the color of the rectangles identified in Q3 to the color of the largest rectangle in the input grid.
Q7: Replace the numbers 1, 3, 4, 6, and 7 in the input grid with the color of the largest rectangle in the input grid.
